item.title: Dead fox on the corner of Creek Rd and Glaisher St, 11th September
item.description:
Hi, I called last night (10th) but it was after hours, I was asked to report the location here. The fox is right by the little green bushes (on the grass) just before/by the construction site/road works (the area is blocked but the fox is just before the blockades), on the left hand side of Glaisher Street, corner of Creek Road. It's recently deceased and very upsetting to see, I hope that it can be removed in a respectful way. I'm not sure how long it's been there but it didn't look like it had started to decompose so I don't think very long. I don't live in the area so can't say for sure. Thank you in advance. Kind regards, Anna
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 135, Creek Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned Vehicle Preventing Bin Collection, 11th September
item.description:
Dear Team, This vehicle has been abandoned between 1 Camlan Road and 3 Camlan Road for almost 2 months. It has a flat tire and owner has not spoken to anyone or come back, so we don't know what's going on. As it's a large vehicle it prevents the waste collectors from seeing our bins put out. Unfortunately, we can't just move our bins up the road for waste collectors to see, because our neighbours have open driveways that cannot be obstructed. Because of this full bins are being left behind and attracting foxes who litter the pavement and drives. Please help. Many thanks.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Camlan Road, Downham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish and food being left on street, 10th September
item.description:
Despite a communal bin now being available, bags of rubbish and food is being left on the street by the tree almost daily before 5.30 am. The food attracts animals that scatter the refuse across the street / excrete on vehicles.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Oldhill Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Local bin never being emptied by nature garden, 10th September
item.description:
Outside the beautiful nature park the bin is never being emptied when needed. Please fix this immediately and have someone not just bag up the rubbish but have it taken away same day
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Benhill Road, Camberwell, London
Report on FixMyStreet
